{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3149954,"name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","username":"bob.wolff68","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T17:51:21.094Z","cooked":"

I just ran the updater for 2023.4.1 this morning on my Mac M1/Arm machine and ran into a complaint of “Java 17 required, but not found. Might have compilation errors.”

Anyone experience this or have a fix?

I had the 2023 WPILIB running all season so far without issue so this is truly just an update situation and not a fresh install for an unknown system. The only other detail is that on my first attempt, I told it not to do any of the VSCode download since I already had it. Once I saw the error, I figured I’d go back and tell it to download VSCode and despite re-running the installer and having it download VSCode, I wind up with the same error.

–bob

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T17:51:21.094Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":254,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":1320.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17188,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3149957,"name":"Fletch","username":"Fletch1373","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/fletch1373/{size}/220073_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T17:53:31.895Z","cooked":"

WPILib ships with JDK17 bundled, so you definitely have it. Could be some weird system PATH shenanigans, or could just be VSCode being dumb.

I havent experienced this personally, so I’ll let others jump in with further advice

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T17:54:03.341Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":245,"readers_count":244,"score":49.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Fletch","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":9105,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/2","custom_user_title":"3181/3015 Mentor | 213/1373 Alum | CSA/FTAA/Jack-of-all-Trades","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150048,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T19:25:11.768Z","cooked":"

macOS just does this sometimes. Sometimes vscode decides its going to search, and other times its not. I have a feeling this is gatekeeper related, but I’ve never been able to root cause it.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-21T19:25:11.768Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":211,"readers_count":210,"score":52.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/3","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150202,"name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","username":"bob.wolff68","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-21T23:56:03.836Z","cooked":"

Hey Thad –
I’d be happy to help ferret out the source of the problem. I do note the following if it is helpful…it seems VERY odd to me.

From an iTerm window running zsh (not inside VSCode) I get the following

$ javac --version
javac 11.0.1
$ which javac
/usr/bin/javac
$ java --version
java 11.0.1 2018-10-16 LTS
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.1+13-LTS)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.1+13-LTS, mixed mode)
$ which java
/usr/bin/java

Now from inside VSCode also running zsh

$ javac --version
javac 17.0.5
$ which javac
/usr/bin/javac
$ java --version
openjdk 17.0.5 2022-10-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8, mixed mode)
$ which java
/usr/bin/java
$ set | grep PATH
# lots of output, but the final bit I was interested in is below...
PATH='/Users/rwolff/bin:/opt/homebrew/bin:/usr/local/opt/ruby/bin:/usr/local/bin:/Users/rwolff/dev/Qt/qt5build/qtbase/bin:/opt/homebrew/bin:/opt/homebrew/sbin:/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.9/bin:/opt/local/bin:/opt/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/System/Cryptexes/App/usr/bin:/usr/bin:/bin:/usr/sbin:/sbin:/Applications/VMware Fusion Tech Preview.app/Contents/Public:/Library/TeX/texbin:/usr/local/go/bin:/opt/X11/bin:/Library/Apple/usr/bin:/Users/rwolff/wpilib/2023/jdk/bin'

NOTE: My path inside VSCode shows /usr/bin prior to /Users/rwolff/wpilib/2023/jdk/bin which makes me suspicious of what you’re looking for in the plugin and where this might lie. I cannot for the life of me figure HOW two terminal windows that show the same which location for java are both reporting DIFFERENT versions of the tool, however.

Last ‘pair’ - if I explicitly call with full pathing from inside VSCode, I get:

/Users/rwolff/wpilib/2023/jdk/bin/javac --version
javac 17.0.5
/Users/rwolff/wpilib/2023/jdk/bin/java --version
openjdk 17.0.5 2022-10-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8, mixed mode)
/usr/bin/javac --version
javac 17.0.5
/usr/bin/java --version
openjdk 17.0.5 2022-10-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8, mixed mode)

And the final baffling permutation - running full path combinations from iTerm (not inside VSCode), I get a different version despite the same literal full path name.

$ /usr/bin/javac --version
javac 11.0.1
$ /usr/bin/java --version
java 11.0.1 2018-10-16 LTS
Java(TM) SE Runtime Environment 18.9 (build 11.0.1+13-LTS)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM 18.9 (build 11.0.1+13-LTS, mixed mode)
$ /Users/rwolff/wpilib/2023/jdk/bin/javac --version
javac 17.0.5
$ /Users/rwolff/wpilib/2023/jdk/bin/java --version
openjdk 17.0.5 2022-10-18
OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8)
OpenJDK 64-Bit Server VM Temurin-17.0.5+8 (build 17.0.5+8, mixed mode)

And thats exactly the problem. macOS for “security” reasons can do some very weird stuff with path, and its extremely difficult to debug. And its not well documented at all, again for “Security” reasons, which makes it even harder to debug.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T01:36:15.157Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":112,"readers_count":111,"score":27.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17188,"username":"bob.wolff68","name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/5","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150268,"name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","username":"bob.wolff68","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T02:27:07.337Z","cooked":"

That seems so crazy. Especially since everything was working fine until today when I installed the 2023.4.1 update. Do you have any thoughts on what I can do to either ‘force’ it to take the right java? I’m the head programming mentor for team 1967 and while I don’t need to have a working dev station today or tomorrow, by this weekend I’ll be in pretty big need to be able to build along with the team.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T02:27:07.337Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":27.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16147,"username":"Thad_House","name":"Thad House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17188,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150272,"name":"Thad House","username":"Thad_House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T02:32:18.687Z","cooked":"

That message doesn’t actually stop anything from working, and everything should still work just fine.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T02:32:18.687Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":103,"readers_count":102,"score":25.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Thad House","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":17188,"username":"bob.wolff68","name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":16147,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/7","custom_user_title":"WPILib Dev | 2025 VOTY","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150286,"name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","username":"bob.wolff68","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T02:56:58.224Z","cooked":"

Thad,
Thanks for clarifying this for me. Once I saw the initial error, it seemed the build simply didn’t take place, but I didn’t think of simply trying it again. Indeed you’re correct - it did build. The complaint is benign. Unfortunate - but benign.
Thanks,
bob

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T02:56:58.224Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":24.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":16147,"username":"Thad_House","name":"Thad House","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/t/a4c791/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17188,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150314,"name":"Kabir","username":"kn4","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kn4/{size}/235296_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T03:24:20.834Z","cooked":"

The discrepancy between VSCode and iTerm is probably caused by the fact that on macOS, /usr/bin/java (and other java-related executables in /usr/bin) are not actually a JDK, but instead tools that attempt to find a Java installation and redirect the command to actual Java.

WPILib VSCode sets the JAVA_HOME environment variable to the WPILib JDK location, so /usr/bin/java looks there first and uses that JDK. In iTerm, /usr/bin/java does not “know about” your WPILib JDK, so it finds a different JDK and uses that.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T03:24:20.834Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":90,"readers_count":89,"score":23.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Kabir","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57470,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2724 programmer"},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/9","custom_user_title":"2724 programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150317,"name":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","username":"bob.wolff68","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/bob.wolff68/{size}/5780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T03:27:32.955Z","cooked":"

@kn4 - bingo that makes a ton of sense. I couldn’t figure why which would play some dark magic games when it’s such a tried and true tool. But the /usr/bin/java playing its own “HOME” games makes a bunch of sense. Thanks for adding back to my sanity bucket.

–bob

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2023-02-22T03:27:32.955Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":85,"readers_count":84,"score":17.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427608,"topic_slug":"wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error","display_username":"Bob Wolff - Janksters Team 1967","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":57470,"username":"kn4","name":"Kabir","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/kn4/{size}/235296_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":17188,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/wpilib-update-2023-4-1-java-17-required-error/427608/10","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3150712,"name":"NewtonCrosby","username":"NewtonCrosby","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ed8c4c/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-02-22T19:44:20.282Z","cooked":"

@Thad_House
I ran the online updater and got an error that it couldn’t find SmartDashboard for M1 macs. I put a thread and a github issue in for it that Peter responded to that it was a known bug.

After doing that, I could no longer execute things like Shuffleboard nor Java from the command line.

I Downloaded the offline installer, re-ran the “Install Everything” and still couldn’t execute java -version.

No error, just a terminal report of “Killed -9”.

The only way around this for me was to manually unpack the Offline installer artifacts, run xattr -d to remove the quarantine flag, and overwrite the two jdk directories in wpilib/2023. Not sure if this is related in any way or not.

Edit to add:

I think I got my franken-installation working just fine. Everything seems to work.

Here’s my project info

WPILib Information:
Project Version: 2023.4.1
VS Code Version: 1.74.2
WPILib Extension Version: 2023.4.1
C++ Extension Version: 1.13.8
Java Extension Version: 1.14.0
Java Debug Extension Version: 0.47.0
Java Dependencies Extension Version 0.21.1
Java Version: 17
Java Location: /Users/scott/wpilib/2023/jdk
Vendor Libraries:
KauaiLabs_navX_FRC (2023.0.1)
CTRE-Phoenix (v5) (5.30.2)
